title: I've figured out how to beat the system.
body:
Compliment your 'teammates', deploy the sarcasm cannons.

Remove the toxins and take this to the next level. Create a disease for which the world isn't prepared.

Lets get those creative reverse insults going, ban this riot. *maniacal laugh

replies.body:
I *almost* took this down for Advocating Violations of the Rules. 

I didn't, because "remove the toxins" is a nice thought.  But the sarcasm isn't, and in general these "let's beat the system" kind of posts advocating trying to provoke others in in-game chat have got to stop.

Trying to provoke other people into account bans or punishments is serious, no-no behavior.  It hurts the community, and provokes people who might otherwise be well-behaved into punishment or even account loss.  I am probably the moderator with the strictest stance on these kinds of posts, and I have issued some very lengthy Boards bans over the practice.  Genuinely malicious intent to provoke other users is against the following part of the [Universal Board Rules](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE):

> Advocating Violations of the Rules
>
> Do not post content advocating or soliciting violations of the Terms of Use, Summonerâ€™s Code, or Board Rules. Players encouraging this sort of behavior will be punished as if they had engaged in it themselves.

We as moderators understand that the community can be frustrated with the kind of toxicity that doesn't show up on chat, and the difficulty in punishing the same.  We absolutely encourage *productive* discussion about how to fix these problems.  

That does *not* make it okay to try to provoke others on purpose, nor will it, ever.
